verses.verse: The words <WH1697> of Agur <WH94> the son <WH1121> of Jakeh, <WH3348> the oracle: <WH4853> the man <WH1397> says <WH5002> to Ithiel, <WH384> to Ithiel <WH384> and Ucal: <WH401>
"Surely I am the most ignorant <WH1198> man, <WH376> and don't <WH376> have a man's understanding. <WH998>
I have not learned <WH3925> wisdom, <WH2451> neither do I have <WH3045> the knowledge <WH1847> of the Holy One. <WH6918>

Who has ascended up <WH5927> into heaven, <WH8064> and descended? <WH3381> Who has gathered <WH622> the wind <WH7307> in his fists? <WH2651> Who has bound <WH6887> the waters <WH4325> in his garment? <WH8071> Who has established <WH6965> all the ends <WH657> of the earth? <WH776> What is his name, <WH8034> and what is his son <WH1121>'s name, <WH8034> if you know? <WH3045>
"Every word <WH565> of God <WH433> is flawless. <WH6884> He is a shield <WH4043> to those who take refuge in him. <WH2620>
Don't <WH3254> you add to his words, <WH1697> lest he reprove <WH3198> you, <WH3576> and you be found a liar.
"Two <WH8147> things I have asked <WH7592> of you; <WH4513> don't deny me before I die: <WH4191>

Remove far <WH7368> from me falsehood <WH7723> and lies. <WH1697> Give <WH5414> me neither poverty <WH7389> nor riches. <WH6239> Feed <WH2963> me with the food <WH3899> that is needful for me; <WH2706>
lest I be full, <WH7646> deny <WH3584> you, <WH559> and say, <WH3068> 'Who is Yahweh?' or lest I be poor, <WH3423> and steal, <WH1589> and so dishonor <WH8610> the name <WH8034> of my God. <WH430>
"Don't <WH3960> slander a servant <WH5650> to his master, <WH113> lest he curse <WH7043> you, <WH816> and you be held guilty.
There is a generation <WH1755> that curses <WH7043> their father, <WH1> and doesn't <WH1288> bless their mother. <WH517>
There is a generation <WH1755> that is pure <WH2889> in their own eyes, <WH5869> yet are not washed <WH7364> from their filthiness. <WH6675>
There is a generation, <WH1755> oh how lofty <WH7311> are their eyes! <WH5869> Their eyelids <WH6079> are lifted up. <WH5375>

There is a generation <WH1755> whose teeth <WH8127> are like swords, <WH2719> and their jaws <WH4973> like knives, <WH3979> to devour <WH398> the poor <WH6041> from the earth, <WH776> and the needy <WH34> from among men. <WH120>

"The leach <WH5936> has two <WH8147> daughters: <WH1323> <WH3051> 'Give, give. <WH3051>' "There are three <WH7969> things that are never satisfied; <WH7646> four <WH702> that <WH559> don't <WH1952> say, 'Enough:'
Sheol, <WH7585> the barren <WH6115> womb; <WH7356> the earth <WH776> that is not satisfied <WH7646> with water; <WH4325> and the fire <WH784> that doesn't <WH559> say, <WH1952> 'Enough.'

"The eye <WH5869> that mocks <WH3932> at his father, <WH1> and scorns <WH936> obedience <WH3349> to his mother: <WH517> the ravens <WH6158> of the valley <WH5158> shall pick it out, <WH5365> the young <WH1121> eagles <WH5404> shall eat it. <WH398>
"There are three <WH7969> things which are too amazing <WH6381> for me, <WH702> four which I don't <WH3045> understand:

The way <WH1870> of an eagle <WH5404> in the air; <WH8064> the way <WH1870> of a serpent <WH5175> on a rock; <WH6697> the way <WH1870> of a ship <WH591> in the midst <WH3820> of the sea; <WH3220> and the way <WH1870> of a man <WH1397> with a maiden. <WH5959>
"So is the way <WH1870> of an adulterous <WH5003> woman: <WH802> she eats <WH398> and wipes <WH4229> her mouth, <WH6310> and says, <WH559> <WH6466> 'I have done nothing wrong. <WH205>'
"For three <WH7969> things the earth <WH776> tremble, <WH7264> and under four, <WH702> it can't <WH3201> bear up: <WH5375>
For a servant <WH5650> when he is king; <WH4427> a fool <WH5036> when he is filled <WH7646> with food; <WH3899>
for an unloved <WH8130> woman when she is married; <WH1166> and a handmaid <WH8198> who is heir <WH3423> to her mistress. <WH1404>
"There are four <WH702> things which are little <WH6996> on the earth, <WH776> but they are exceedingly <WH2449> wise: <WH2450>
the ants <WH5244> are not a strong <WH5794> people, <WH5971> yet they provide <WH3559> their food <WH3899> in the summer. <WH7019>
The conies <WH8227> are but a feeble <WH6099> folk, <WH5971> yet make <WH7760> they their houses <WH1004> in the rocks. <WH5553>
The locusts <WH697> have no king, <WH4428> yet they advance <WH3318> in ranks. <WH2686>
You can catch <WH8610> a lizard <WH8079> with your hands, <WH3027> yet it is in kings <WH4428>' palaces. <WH1964>
"There are three <WH7969> things which are stately <WH3190> in their march, <WH6806> four <WH702> which are stately <WH2895> in going: <WH3212>
The lion, <WH3918> which is mightiest <WH1368> among animals, <WH929> and doesn't <WH7725> turn away for any; <WH6440>
the greyhound, <WH4975> the male goat <WH8495> also; <WH176> and the king <WH4428> against whom there is no rising up. <WH510>
"If you have done foolishly <WH5034> in lifting up <WH5375> yourself, <WH2161> or if you have thought evil, put your hand <WH3027> over your mouth. <WH6310>

For as the churning <WH4330> of milk <WH2461> brings forth <WH3318> butter, <WH2529> and the wringing <WH4330> of the nose <WH639> brings forth <WH3318> blood; <WH1818> so the forcing <WH4330> of wrath <WH639> brings forth <WH3318> strife. <WH7379>"
